month.name: January
month.holidayList: New Year's Day
Pongal, Harvest Festival of South India
India Republic Day
Martin Luther King, Jr. Day

month.name: February
month.holidayList: Milad-Un-Nabi, Mawlid an-Nabi – Birth of the Islamic Prophet Muhammad.
President's Day

month.name: March
month.holidayList: Mahashivratri / Maha Sivaratri, Great Night of Shiva – offerings of Bael (Bilva) leaves to the Lord Shiva, a Hindu festival
Holi, Hindu festival of colours

month.name: April
month.holidayList: Mahavir Jayanthi, Birth of Mahavira, the last Tirthankara – the most important religious holiday in Jainism
Good Friday, Death of Jesus – Christian holiday
Easter Monday, Resurrection of Jesus – Christian holiday
Easter

month.name: May
month.holidayList: Buddha Purnima - Vesak Day - Celebrates birth, enlightenment, and death of Buddha
Mother's Day
Memorial Day

month.name: June
month.holidayList: Father's Day

month.name: July
month.holidayList: Independence Day

month.name: August
month.holidayList: Raksha Bandhan - Hindu Festival celebrated mainly in northern India
Independence Day
Krishna Janmashtami / Srikrishna Jayanti - Birth of Krishna – a Hindu festival celebrating birth of Lord Krishna, an avatar of god Vishnu
Eid ul-Fitr – End of Ramadan, according to Islamic Calendar

month.name: September
month.holidayList: Ganesh Chaturthi - Hindu Festival to celebrate the birthday of Lord Ganesh (Ganesha). Anant Chaturdashi will be celebrated on the last day of Ganesh Chaturthi, Monday, 12 September 2011.
Dussehra - Vijaya Dashami – Hindu festival

month.name: October
month.holidayList: Gandhi Jayanti - Mahatma Gandhi's Birthday
Deepavali / Diwali - Festival of Lights – a very important Hindu festival

month.name: November
month.holidayList: Idu'l Zuha/Bakrid - Eid al-Adha – Feast of the Sacrifice, according to Islamic Calendar
Guru Nanak Jayanti - Guru Nanak's Birthday – Sikh Festival
Muharram - Islamic New Year

month.name: December
month.holidayList: Christmas Day - Birth of Jesus – one of Christian most important holidays.
Boxing Day - The day after Christmas – Christian Holiday
